Sentencas: Compression seals based on metal/mica composites were investigated under solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) operating conditions.
Titulo: Deformation behavior and leakage tests of alternate sealing materials for SOFC stacks

Sentencas: Since a compressive force has to be permanently applied in this sealing concept, the mechanical properties of the sealing materials and the SOFC components also became important for maintaining gas tightness.
Titulo: Deformation behavior and leakage tests of alternate sealing materials for SOFC stacks

Sentencas: Leakage tests with a sandwich arrangement of mica paper and embossed metallic profiles show leak rates of <1 x 10(-4) mbar l/mm s under an applied normalized compressive load of 2.7 N/mm (0.7 MPa).
Titulo: Deformation behavior and leakage tests of alternate sealing materials for SOFC stacks

Sentencas: Also under thermal cycles between ambient temperature and 800degreesC this leak rate does not change due to the elastic response of the seal.
Titulo: Deformation behavior and leakage tests of alternate sealing materials for SOFC stacks

Sentencas: Compression tests with the seals in contact with SOFC membranes reveal no damage to the membranes.
Titulo: Deformation behavior and leakage tests of alternate sealing materials for SOFC stacks

Sentencas: First results of leakage tests with SOFC stacks are presented, which may serve as a reference for future leakage tests of alternative sealing systems.
Titulo: Deformation behavior and leakage tests of alternate sealing materials for SOFC stacks
